xv6/bootmain.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 // Boot loader.
00002 // 
00003 // Part of the boot sector, along with bootasm.S, which calls bootmain().
00004 // bootasm.S has put the processor into protected 32-bit mode.
00005 // bootmain() loads an ELF kernel image from the disk starting at
00006 // sector 1 and then jumps to the kernel entry routine.
00007 
00008 #include "types.h"
00009 #include "elf.h"
00010 #include "x86.h"
00011 
00012 #define SECTSIZE  512
00013 
00014 void readseg(uchar*, uint, uint);
00015 
00016 void
00017 bootmain(void)
00018 {
00019   struct elfhdr *elf;
00020   struct proghdr *ph, *eph;
00021   void (*entry)(void);
00022   uchar* va;
00023 
00024   elf = (struct elfhdr*)0x10000;  // scratch space
00025 
00026   // Read 1st page off disk
00027   readseg((uchar*)elf, 4096, 0);
00028 
00029   // Is this an ELF executable?
00030   if(elf->magic != ELF_MAGIC)
00031     return;  // let bootasm.S handle error
00032 
00033   // Load each program segment (ignores ph flags).
00034   ph = (struct proghdr*)((uchar*)elf + elf->phoff);
00035   eph = ph + elf->phnum;
00036   for(; ph < eph; ph++) {
00037     va = (uchar*)(ph->va & 0xFFFFFF);
00038     readseg(va, ph->filesz, ph->offset);
00039     if(ph->memsz > ph->filesz)
00040       stosb(va + ph->filesz, 0, ph->memsz - ph->filesz);
00041   }
00042 
00043   // Call the entry point from the ELF header.
00044   // Does not return!
00045   entry = (void(*)(void))(elf->entry & 0xFFFFFF);
00046   entry();
00047 }
00048 
00049 void
00050 waitdisk(void)
00051 {
00052   // Wait for disk ready.
00053   while((inb(0x1F7) & 0xC0) != 0x40)
00054     ;
00055 }
00056 
00057 // Read a single sector at offset into dst.
00058 void
00059 readsect(void *dst, uint offset)
00060 {
00061   // Issue command.
00062   waitdisk();
00063   outb(0x1F2, 1);   // count = 1
00064   outb(0x1F3, offset);
00065   outb(0x1F4, offset >> 8);
00066   outb(0x1F5, offset >> 16);
00067   outb(0x1F6, (offset >> 24) | 0xE0);
00068   outb(0x1F7, 0x20);  // cmd 0x20 - read sectors
00069 
00070   // Read data.
00071   waitdisk();
00072   insl(0x1F0, dst, SECTSIZE/4);
00073 }
00074 
00075 // Read 'count' bytes at 'offset' from kernel into virtual address 'va'.
00076 // Might copy more than asked.
00077 void
00078 readseg(uchar* va, uint count, uint offset)
00079 {
00080   uchar* eva;
00081 
00082   eva = va + count;
00083 
00084   // Round down to sector boundary.
00085   va -= offset % SECTSIZE;
00086 
00087   // Translate from bytes to sectors; kernel starts at sector 1.
00088   offset = (offset / SECTSIZE) + 1;
00089 
00090   // If this is too slow, we could read lots of sectors at a time.
00091   // We'd write more to memory than asked, but it doesn't matter --
00092   // we load in increasing order.
00093   for(; va < eva; va += SECTSIZE, offset++)
00094     readsect(va, offset);
00095 }
